summary: This document is an email chain from August 12-13, 2019, discussing technical issues with the recording system at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) where Jeffrey Epstein was held. The FBI is retrieving previous recordings, which will disable recording capabilities for 8-10 days, prompting inquiries about interim recording solutions.

events.title: FBI Retrieves MCC Recording System
events.description: The FBI is retrieving previous recordings from the camera system at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), disabling recording capabilities for 8-10 days while data is retrieved.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively retrieving video recordings from the camera system at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on or around August 12, 2019.
The retrieval process was expected to disable the facility's recording capabilities for 8-10 days, though live monitoring remained functional.
The correspondence shows internal discussions among prison or law enforcement officials about procuring emergency replacement equipment to maintain recording during the FBI's investigation.
The document is dated August 13, 2019, which is shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody at the MCC on August 10, 2019, indicating post-incident investigative activity.
All specific names of individuals involved in the email chain are redacted in the provided text.
